meanings.sent1: The rowts of thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The rowts of the crowd at the concert filled the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The rowts of the children playing outside could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent4: The rowts of the engines echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The rowts of the fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: To make a loud noise or uproar.
meanings.sent1: The kids rowts when they play together in the park.
meanings.sent2: The protesters rowts for their rights in the streets.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys rowts loudly in the zoo, entertaining the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The wind rowts through the trees, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The thunder rowts in the distance, signaling an approaching storm.

meanings.sent1: The rowts between the siblings over the toy was resolved peacefully.
meanings.sent2: The rowts between the neighbors could be heard from across the street.
meanings.sent3: The rowts over the last piece of cake ended with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The rowts in the courtroom were silenced by the judge's gavel.
meanings.sent5: The rowts among the team members were quickly settled with a compromise.

meanings.sent1: The siblings rowts over who gets to sit in the front seat.
meanings.sent2: The politicians rowts during the debate, trying to prove their points.
meanings.sent3: The friends rowts playfully over which movie to watch.
meanings.sent4: The customers rowts with the manager about the service received.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors rowts about the property line, each claiming their own space.
